 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/4229 | Kontakt: Freja Annamatz, Kommunikationsdirektör freja.annamatz@regionstockholm.se, Åsa Hytter Landahl, Rekryterandechef asa.hytter-landahl@regionstockholm.se, | Facklig företrädare: SACO saco.karolinska.karolinska@regionstockholm.se, Vision vision.karolinska@regionstockholm.se, | Publicerat: 2025-06-30 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-24

title: SDR Team Lead
description:
*At Benifex, we’re on a mission to revolutionize employee benefits and engagement. Born from the merger of Benify and Benefex, we’ve combined forces to build remarkable experiences that employees love. With 1,300+ Benifexers across 14 global offices, we partner with 3,000 customers in 120+ countries, supporting 5 million users worldwide* 
 🌍
 *. To help us on our journey, we're looking for passionate, driven people to join us. That's where you come in!* 




  





**Why should you apply? 🌟** 



* Real impact: Take the lead in driving pipeline generation for the Nordic region and help shape our SDR function.
* Hands-on leadership: Coach and support a growing team, joining calls, giving feedback, and building best practices.
* Reputation: Work for a company well known as the market leader within benefits and rewards.
* Career growth: Step into a key commercial role with scope to influence structure, process, and strategy.
* Fast-growing & profitable: Be part of a high-performing business in a thriving market with huge growth potential.
* Cross-functional collaboration: Work closely with Account Executives to align outbound efforts with revenue goals.
* Global exposure: Report directly to the Head of Global Business Development and collaborate with international teams.



  





**Role overview 🚀** 




 We’re looking for a Team Lead to grow, support, and drive performance in our Nordic SDR team. You’ll play a key role in hitting pipeline targets through clear direction, hands-on collaboration, and data-driven coaching. This role blends leadership with action—you’ll lead by example, join calls, give feedback, and help scale the SDR function. Reporting to the Head of Global Business Development, you’ll have the unique opportunity to bridge strategy and execution in a high-impact, commercial role.
 



  





**Responsibilities🤘** 



* Lead, support and coach the Nordic SDR team to ensure a high-performing culture and successful lead generation.
* Collaborate with the Head of Global Business Development to plan headcount, territory coverage and team structure.
* Ensure there’s consistent and sufficient pipeline coverage aligned to revenue targets.
* Review and optimize SDR performance dashboards and KPIs regularly.
* Support pipeline management and conversion metrics—ensure meetings booked are progressing through the funnel.
* Roll up your sleeves: join calls, listen to recordings, provide real-time coaching and feedback.
* Help manage data accuracy across tools like Salesforce; make sure SDRs have the right accounts and enough contacts to work.
* Participate in forecasting, data projects and territory mapping.
* Serve as the go-to resource for questions, blockers and challenges across the team.
* Lead by example with resilience, positivity, and a solutions-first mindset—while embodying our core values: Show Love, Never Stand Still, Own It, and Remarkable Together.



  





**What are we looking for? 🔎** 




**Experience Required** 



* Previous experience as an SDR/BDR is essential—you know what it takes to succeed.
* Demonstrated ability to hit or exceed your targets in a new business development role.
* Excellent skills in outbound calling, lead generation and prospecting.
* Experience coaching or upskilling others—official team lead experience is a big plus but not required.
* Professional proficiency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.



  





**Nice To Have** 



* Experience working in SaaS or B2B tech environments.
* University degree preferred (but not required)—we value grit and experience more than credentials.
* Experience working in Salesforce or similar CRM-system.



  





**Personal Attributes** 



* Relationship building: A natural coach and team player who lifts others up. Builds strong, lasting relationships and fosters a positive, high-performing culture.
* Communication and presentation skills: Communicates effectively at all levels, both written and verbal. Delivers clear updates, impactful presentations, and influences through strong storytelling.
* Sales effectiveness: Brings energy, clarity, and resilience to outbound efforts. Perseveres to meet targets and leads by example in execution and coaching.
* Commercial acumen: Data-driven and organized. Aligns pipeline efforts with commercial goals, forecasts accurately, and takes ownership of team results.
* Problem solving: Detail-oriented and proactive. Anticipates issues, solves challenges quickly, and supports others with clarity and structure.



  





 Our recruitment process ✌
 



 Benifex understands the need to have a fast and efficient process, the below will all be completed in the shortest time possible.
 



 📞 Initial Zoom call with the Talent team
 



 🧪 Online personality- and logic reasoning tests
 



 📚 Prepare and deliver a 10-minute case presentation
 



 ⏳ Interview with the hiring manager
 



 🤝 Final interview with a senior stakeholder
 



 ✅ Reference check
 



  





**Perks of being a Benifexer** 



* Competitive base salary plus commission
* Collective agreement
* Wellness allowance of 4000 SEK
* 30 vacation days
* ITP1 pension
* Lifeplan - a leading financial advisory service that offers personalized advice for maximizing your pension savings
* Volunteer days – 2 paid days annually to give back to the community
* Access to our award-winning benefits platform
* A variety of social events and activities at our offices
* Workation - possibility to work abroad within EU & UK 2 weeks/quarter
* Hybrid working - minimum 3 days/week from the office.



  





 As a Benifexer, you'll enjoy a forward-thinking culture that encourages personal and professional growth. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that values creativity and new ideas, with a commitment to diversity and inclusion. With a nearly gender-balanced team, we prioritize creating a supportive workplace where everyone can thrive.
 



  





**Practical information** 



* Start: As soon as we find the right match!
* Extent: Full-time, 100%
* Location: Apelbergsgatan 33A, Stockholm.


- 


 📢 Interested in the role of SDR Team Lead? Apply by submitting your CV and/or your LinkedIn profile in
 **English** 
 by using the application form below. We screen applications continuously, so ensure to apply as quickly as possible.
 



  





*Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments for interviews by replying to the email you will receive after you apply.*

title: Head of People Operations – Sweden (Paternity Cover)
description:
GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.
   

  

*Would you like to step into a strategic HR role where your expertise helps shape a modern and digital workplace? Are you curious to see what it’s like to work across the Nordics, in a team that truly believes in transparency, collaboration, and making things work in real life—not just on paper?*
 At GlobalConnect, we’re looking for a skilled HR operations and legal professional to temporarily join us as
 **Head of People Operations – Sweden** 
 , covering for paternity leave. This is your opportunity to make a real difference, ensuring our Swedish HR operations are smooth, compliant, and people-first—while also gaining cross-Nordic experience within a growing and ambitious company.
   

  

 You’ll be part of a Nordic People Operations team with colleagues based in Stockholm, Copenhagen, Oslo, Helsinki, and Hamburg, reporting to our Head of Group People Operations. Your base will be in our
 **Stockholm office** 
 , where you’ll be our local go-to person for HR operations, governance, compliance, and local processes. You’ll also work closely with the broader People & Culture department and have regular interaction with Swedish union representatives.
   

  

 This is a hands-on and highly impactful role. You won’t just be working with policies—you’ll be shaping how we actually get things done.
   

  

**A Few Of The Things You’ll Be Doing**
* Oversee HR operations for our Swedish organization during the temporary period
* Act as our local contact for Swedish union interactions and negotiations
* Ensure compliance with Swedish labor law, agreements, and employment standards
* Handle cases related to sick leave, work environment, and performance
* Respond to incoming HR inquiries from managers and employees, supporting them with guidance and practical solutions
* Contribute to shaping and applying groupwide HR processes in a Swedish context


**Who We Are—and Why This Role Matters**
 You’ll join a Nordic People Operations team that makes sure things run smoothly for our 2000+ colleagues across the region. From compliance and governance to making sure people feel secure in their work environment—our work creates structure and clarity. We collaborate across countries, we work hybrid, and we make space for both professional focus and real-life needs.
   

  

 At GlobalConnect, we keep things practical and people-focused. We value common sense, clear communication, and creating HR processes that support—not slow down—the people they’re meant for.
   

  

**To get going in this role, we think you’ll need:**
* Good knowledge of Swedish labor law and employment practices
* Experience working with unions and collective agreements
* Experience in a similar HR operations role, ideally in a Nordic or international context
* Fluency in Swedish and English (spoken and written)


 This is a
 **temporary position** 
 based in
 **Stockholm** 
 , covering for
 **paternity leave** 
 .
   

  

 No personal letter is needed unless there’s something you’d like to clarify that isn’t in your CV or LinkedIn profile.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Quality Coordinator
description:
**Location:** 
 Luleå
   

  

**Country:** 
 Sweden
   

  

**Application due date:** 
 8/15/2025 23:59:59 UTC
   

  

 We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Quality Coordinator to join our team for a large-scale construction project. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring that all aspects of quality related to the project’s scope—including design, construction, equipment delivery and installation, as well as operational phases—are effectively managed. This role will play a key part in supporting project management and construction teams in quality control and assurance while fostering a strong culture of quality awareness throughout the building process.
   

  

 Becoming part of the SSAB family means joining a journey. A journey that we believe is essential for the sustainability of this planet. Steel has been one of the most important materials for developing our society and it will continue to be so. In the roofs over our heads, in the bridges connecting our cities and in the cars of tomorrow. At SSAB we are proud of our history and leadership in high-strength steel. But we are also aware that the production of steel is one of the largest emitters of greenhouse gases in the world. That has to change. That is why we have developed the world’s ﬁrst fossil free steel production and has committed to becoming largely fossil-free. As part of SSAB you will be instrumental in realizing this goal and push for the green transformation of the whole steel industry.
   

  

**About The Position**
 This role will collaborate closely with the PMO team, construction teams, contract management, HSE departments, procurement, contractors, and OEMs to ensure quality standards are met throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Please note that we are taking a summer break in our recruitment process during the Swedish industrial vacation period, which runs from July 1st to early August. This means that we will not be reviewing applications or conducting interviews during the month of July. The recruitment process will resume in early August. Thank you for your patience and understanding regarding any delays.
   

  

****Main Responsibilities****
* Develop and maintain a Quality Management Plan (QMP) to ensure adherence to quality standards throughout the project lifecycle, including design, construction, and equipment installation.
* Collaborate with design and construction teams to verify compliance with quality standards, review documentation, conduct inspections, and resolve issues.
* Oversee installation, integration, and testing of equipment, ensuring adherence to protocols and resolving any issues during commissioning and start-up.
* Identify and address deviations and non-conformities, implementing corrective actions and maintaining detailed records.
* Evaluate and monitor suppliers and contractors, conducting audits and overseeing material inspections to ensure compliance with quality standards.
* Prepare and present quality reports and documentation for internal and external stakeholders, including OEMs and contractors.
* Conduct post-project reviews to document lessons learned and identify areas for improvement.


**About You**
* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Industrial Management, Construction Management, or a related field.
* Proven experience in quality assurance and control within design, construction, and equipment installation, particularly in complex, large-scale projects.
* Expertise in quality control methodologies, inspection techniques, and testing procedures.
* Strong knowledge of quality and sustainability management systems (e.g., ISO 9001, Six Sigma, Lean Manufacturing).
* Excellent analytical, communication, and decision-making skills with the ability to build strong partnerships internally and externally.


**Our offer**
 At SSAB we strive for a diverse and inclusive environment. We use our values – driven, true and ahead – in making everyday decisions, keeping the customer at the heart of what we do. This makes us all team players, each with the drive to improve. When joining SSAB you will become part of an organization of passionate problem solvers working together on important challenges. We will support your growth by providing a safe and friendly workplace that contributes to work-life balance. If you set out to achieve it, at SSAB you will have the possibility of broadening your skills and grow within your field or beyond.
   

  

 We offer a wide range of appreciated benefits to our employees. Some examples of these are listed here:
   

  

 Profit sharing
   

  

 Life balance through reduction of working hours
   

  

 Wellness grants
   

  

**Recruitment process**
 1. Apply
   

  

 2. Interview
   

  

 3. Come and meet us
   

  

 4. Health Examination
   

  

 5. Reference check
   

  

 6. Sign
   

  

 Background check may be a part of the recruitment process.
   

  

**Got questions about this position?**
 Contact Rodrigo Ramalho, Director PMO, Transformation Office
   

  

 Contact Rodrigo via mail - rodrigo.ramalho@ssab.com
   

  

 Contact Petra Fekete, Talent Acquisition Partner, Transformation Office, Group Functions
   

  

 Contact Petra via mail - petra.fekete@ssab.com
   

  

 We decline contacts from recruitment agencies and ad sellers regarding this advertisement.
   

  

 Trade union information is provided by Akademikerföreningen, Unionen and Ledarna, which can be reached via our switchboard on phone +46 920 920 00.
   

  

**Words from your future manager**
 “At SSAB, we’re on an incredible transformation journey toward fossil-free steel. For me personally, being part of this project through the Transformation Office is one of the most exciting and meaningful opportunities I’ve ever experienced. It’s not just about revolutionizing SSAB’s production to green steel. It’s about creating a lasting positive impact on society and Sweden as a whole.
   

  

 As the Project Management Office (PMO) leader, my goal is to build a high-functioning PMO that truly drives this transformation. To make this vision a reality, I’m looking for passionate and motivated individuals to join our incredible multi-cultural team. Together, we’ll steer, lead, and control the project with a shared sense of purpose and determination.
   

  

 Our PMO oversees six distinct functional areas, and your team will be around 7-10 people from start, plus consultants. It plays a vital role in ensuring that we stay on track with cost, time, and quality while delivering on this transformative journey. If this sounds like a journey you’d like to be part of, I can’t wait to hear from you!”
   

  

 Rodrigo Ramalho, Director PMO, Transformation Office
   

  

**Join us at SSAB**

title: Kammarrätten i Stockholm söker en ordningsvakt
description:
*Kammarrätten har som domstol ett viktigt samhällsuppdrag och våra medarbetare har en central roll i detta. Här värderar vi professionalism, tydlighet och viljan att bidra till det goda samhället ur ett medborgarperspektiv. Vårt arbete är korrekt, rättvist och alla blir lyssnade på. Du är värdefull, oavsett roll och hur länge du har arbetat hos oss. Vi tror på eget ansvar och viljan att lära sig. Vi är stolta över det vi gör och vi hoppas att du vill bli en del av det.* 



  

 Om oss
   


 Som ordningsvakt hos oss kommer du att arbeta i ett välfungerande arbetslag som idag består av sju erfarna kollegor – säkerhetssamordnaren (tillika funktionsansvarig), fyra ordningsvakter samt två vaktmästare. De huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifterna är att tillsammans med dina kollegor tillhandahålla en god extern och intern service samt att hålla en hög säkerhetsnivå. Domstolens reception och permanenta säkerhetskontroll är din bas.
 


  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   


 De dagliga arbetsuppgifterna består främst av att ta emot, säkerhetskontrollera och ge service åt besökare, bevaka och säkra ordningen i domstolens entré och publika lokaler samt att övervaka och hantera larm- och bevakningssystem. Att bidra till att skapa en lugn och trygg miljö för såväl externa besökare som domstolens personal är grundläggande. I det ingår att vara en operativ resurs vid säkerhetshöjningar i samband med t.ex. förhandlingar. Även diverse administrativa uppgifter och att bemanna den interna Helpdesk-funktionen ingår. Vid behov kan också stöd till andra servicefunktioner förekomma.
 


  

 Kvalifikationer
   


 Du som söker ska ha:
 


  

  
* ha lägst gymnasieutbildning
  
* kunna uttrycka dig väl på svenska både i tal och skrift
  
* ha ett giltigt förordnande som ordningsvakt i enlighet med nya förordnanden enligt lagen (2023:421) om ordningsvakter
  
* ha erfarenhet av operativt säkerhetsarbete
  
* ha erfarenhet av arbete i reception eller uppgift bedömd likvärdig
  
* ha IT-kompetens
  


  


 Det är meriterande med aktuell utbildning som röntgenoperatör, erfarenhet av IT i allmänhet och salsteknik och larm-/bevakningssystem i synnerhet. Även erfarenhet av att utbilda är en fördel.
 


  


 För att kunna bemanna röntgenutrustningen i säkerhetskontrollen är också fullt färgseende ett krav. (Test kommer att genomföras.)
 


  


 Tjänsten ställer höga krav på förmåga att:
 


  

  
* ge service
  
* samarbeta
  
* ta ansvar
  
* ta egna initiativ
  


  


 Rollen kräver både ett respektfullt och tydligt förhållningssätt i mötet med besökare för ett tryggt och bra bemötande.
 


  


 Eftersom vissa administrativa uppgifter förekommer krävs även en administrativ förmåga.
 


  


 För att bli aktuell för anställning på Kammarrätten i Stockholm krävs att du är lämplig utifrån högt ställda krav gällande omdöme kopplat till ett starkt säkerhetsmedvetande. Det innebär också att du ska stå upp för demokratiska värderingar och att du ska följa svenska lagar.
 


  


 Utdrag kommer att göras från belastnings- och misstankeregistret gällande den person kammarrätten avser att anställa.
 


  


 Du ska, utöver CV och personligt brev, även bifoga kopia på giltigt ordningsvaktsförordnande. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper. Testförfarande ingår i rekryteringsprocessen.
 


  

 Övrigt
   


 Ordinarie arbetstid är förlagd till vardagar kl. 08.00 – 16:30
 


  


 Urval och intervjuer kommer att ske löpande.

title: Sales & Business Development Director
description:
Welcome to SSC –Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
   

  

 With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.
   

  

 SSC also has one of the world’s largest global networks of ground stations for satellite communications. We own and operate the Esrange Space Center in Kiruna, northern Sweden, with the aim of launching satellites in the near future.
   

  

 Are you fueled by a passion for people and the ambition to create an awesome workplace? Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with us to help earth benefit from space?
   

  

 If you answer yes to these questions, we invite you to seize the opportunity to make a significant impact as a Sales & Business Development Director. We are looking for a dedicated coworker who shares our core values of Customer passion, Care, Collaboration, Curiosity, and Courage.
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
 As a Sales & Business Development Director, you will lead the sales efforts for our services: rocket engine tests, reusability tests, test launches, space port services for orbital launches and satellite payloads as a launch service. Together with your team, you will identify new opportunities and expand as well as develop existing businesses, spanning all over the world.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and execute sales strategies to achieve revenue targets and market expansion goals.
* Identify new business opportunities and stay updated on industry trends and competitor activities.
* Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with key clients and stakeholders in the aerospace sector.
* Lead the sales process from prospect until contract signature.
* Perform the preparation and submission of proposals with the support of the OLRT team
* Contract negotiations, on scope, price and terms and conditions
* Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
* Work closely with other SSC divisions and departments, including engineering, marketing, and operations, to ensure seamless project execution and customer satisfaction.


**who We Are**
 The OLRT division operates across these business areas:
   

  

* Rocket Engine Testing – A well-established, fully operational business conducting rocket engine tests.
* Reusability Testing Services – Developed in collaboration with Ariane Group and ESA, this service will be offered to rocket developers to support reusable technology advancements.
* Test Launch Services – Suborbital launches of rockets under development.
* Space Port Services – We provide launch services for orbital rockets.
* Launch Service Provider – We provide orbital space access for satellite owners.


 Our company has a strong track record within Space, deep expertise, and a collaborative learning environment. A great place for the curious to develop new skills and abilities!
   

  

**who You Are**
 We seek a Sales & Business Development Director with a passion for space and people, to build and develop long-term customer and partner relations. While experience in the space industry is beneficial, expertise in related technologies is equally valuable. A general interest in technology and ability to quickly acquire new knowledge is important.
   

  

 Sales is about trust, a close collaboration with the customer as well as our delivery organization is of utmost importance.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Education: University degree in a technical field, or equivalent relevant work experience.
* Languages: Fluent in English, with strong verbal and written communication skills. Swedish is an advantage but not a must.
* Experience: Minimum three years of experience of Sales and Business Development roles
* Skills:
* Solution and result-oriented with a proactive mindset
* Ability to analyze, interpret, and explain complex technical information
* Relationship builder and team player
* Business acumen and negotiation skills
* Excellent communicator, able to simplify complex ideas in both English and Swedish
* Space industry experience
* Additional Requirements:
* Valid B driver’s license
* This is a security classified position (SUA), Swedish citizenship is an advantage but not a must


**LOCATION** 
  

  

 This is a permanent position with 40 hours/week, located at Solna, Kiruna or Esrange.
   

  

**NEXT STEP** 
  

  

 If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait—apply today! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously. We kindly ask you to submit your CV when applying. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.
   

  

 Please note that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications. This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.
   

  

  

  

 This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.
   

  

**WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE** 
  

  

 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
   

  

 With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from space. Learn more at sscspace.com

title: Risk Manager - Medical Device
description:
The world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your Role**
**Responsibilities**
 We are currently looking for a Risk Manager to our compliance, quality and regulator teams either in Malmö, Stockholm or Gothenburg. The primary role of this position is to be responsible for timely planning and proper execution of the risk management in medical device development projects, based on identified and agreed needs to fulfil objectives on project level(s). The responsibility includes:
   

  

* Planning of Risk Management activities
* Execution of Risk Management activities
* Reporting of Risk Management activities


 As a consultant in our life science team, you will be working projects related to Risk Management. In many of our client assignments, our consultants work in teams provided to the client by Capgemini Engineering – but in close collaboration with employees of the client. Capgemini Engineering offers you a work environment that is characterized by innovation. As a consultant at Capgemini Engineering, you are part of something bigger. We deliver, together with our global centers of expertise, solutions for both large global customers and smaller local start-ups. We are driven by meeting the customer's needs and generating added value. By offering exciting opportunities of career development you can get the future you want.
   

  

**Your profile**
* 3+ years of experience of Risk Management within medical device development.
* Strong understanding of medical device regulations and standards
* Proven track record of successfully managing risk management within medical device development projects from concept to commercialization.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and external partners.
* Experience with risk management tools and methodologies
* Fluent in written and spoken English


 You as an person are self-driven, not driven by prestige and a team-player. You are comfortable with leading others and interested in taking the driver’s seat with regards to your own development. You find the consultant role interesting and thrive in a varied environment where changes sometimes take place with abrupt changes. You find it easy to cooperate and communicate with different groups pf people. Genuinely interested in technology and problem solving, and driven by challenges and personal development.
   

  

**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications.


 Join us and get the future you want!
   

  

**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion. Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Assistent till enheten för skog, miljö och forskning
description:
Tycker du om att arbeta med administration och ge service? Kan du möta höga krav på noggrannhet och effektivitet? Som vår nya medarbetare får du ett variationsrikt jobb i en händelserik miljö och vi erbjuder ett utvecklande arbete som bidrar till regeringens politik inom skog, miljö och forskning.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.**
 Som enhetsassistent kommer dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter bestå av att vara ett stöd till chefer och handläggare, vilket bland annat innebär administration kring ärendehandläggning, expediera regerings- och regeringskanslibeslut, språkgranskning, diarieföring, dela och expediera interpellationer samt riksdagsfrågor. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår också att arbeta med enklare IT-stöd, arbete med dokumenthanteringssystem samt att vara ett stöd vid genomförande av digitala möten. I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår att ha en central roll i att bistå chefer och handläggare med administrativa uppgifter vid interna och externa möten, konferenser och seminarier, bistå med inköp och beställningar samt personaladministration och att introducera nya medarbetare. Du kommer att stödja två enheter på departementet och agera i nära samverkan med övriga assistenter på de enheter som arbetar med landsbygdsfrågor. Läs mer om vår verksamhet på www.regeringen.se
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 Vi söker dig som har gymnasieutbildning och har erfarenhet av arbete som enhetsassistent och/eller administratör med kvalificerade administrativa arbetsuppgifter inom Regeringskansliet. För att lyckas i rollen har du erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem, digitala arbetssätt samt genomförande av digitala möten. Du behöver även ha goda kunskaper inom IT och Officepaketet, samt kunna uttrycka dig väl i svenska i både i tal och skrift. Har du en eftergymnasial utbildning från exempelvis universitet eller högskola, kunskap i Excel, SharePoint, dokumentmallar, Agresso, RK-portalen samt kunskap och intresse av digitala arbetssätt och mötesplattformar som exempelvis Skype och Teams, ser vi det som meriterande. Vi ser det också som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av adminsitrativt arbete på departementet.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper**
 Visöker dig som är självständig, serviceinriktad och har en förmåga att kunna arbeta på ett strukturerat sätt. Vidare är du noggrann, flexibel och har vana av att hantera stressiga situationer. Då rollen har många kontaktytor krävs en mycket god samarbetsförmåga.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Tjänsten avser en tillsvidare anställning med sex månaders provananställning.
   

  

 En säkerhetsprövning kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas.
   

  

 Intervjuer kommer att ske i augusti. Då det för närvarande är semestertider har vi begränsad möjlighet att svara på frågor.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?**
 Vill du veta mer om jobbet och vad vi erbjuder, Turid Tersmeden som är enhetschef, alternativt enhetschef Tobias Olsson. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Jennie Sölving för Saco och Ivian Paulino för ST. Du når dem via Regeringskansliets växel, 08-405 10 00. Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Välkommen att registrera din ansökan i vårt rekryteringsverktyg
 **senast den** 
**15 juli** 
 .
   

  

 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering.
   

  

 Landsbygds- och infrastrukturdepartementet ansvarar för frågor som rör landsbygd, livsmedel och areella näringar, regional utveckling, transporter och infrastruktur samt bostäder och samhällsplanering.

title: Avonova Hälsa söker rehabkoordinator/företagssköterska
description:
Vi leder vägen till ett hållbart arbetsliv – varje dag
   

  

*Avonova är Nordens ledande aktör inom företagshälsa och ledarutveckling. Med bred kunskap och stort engagemang hjälper Avonova organisationer och dess medarbetare att bli mer hållbara, kommunicera effektivare och må bättre. Hälsa och arbetsmiljö är avgörande faktorer för att skapa långsiktigt framgångsrika organisationer. Våra 1300 medarbetare på 170 orter levererar varje dag hälsotjänster över hela Norden. Våra kunder finns inom såväl offentlig som privat sektor.*
**Beskrivning**
 Som rehabkoordinator/företagssköterska på Avonova är du utifrån din profession ett stöd åt såväl företagsledningar, chefer och kontaktpersoner/beställare som åt medarbetare. Du är en resurs i hälso- och arbetsmiljöfrågor till chefer och anställda i våra kundföretag med ansvar för planering och genomförande av insatser hos våra kunder. Du ingår i ett team av professionella konsulter med medicinsk, teknisk, psykosocial, organisatorisk och administrativ kompetens samtidigt som du ska tycka om att arbeta självständigt. Du kan komma att arbeta på fler än ett av våra hälsocenter i Stockholmsområdet.
   

  

**I arbetsuppgifterna ingår bland annat:**
* Stöd och rådgivning till chefer och kundanställda i hälso- och arbetsmiljöfrågor (uppdragsdialog)
* Ansvar för att koordinera och samordna rehabiliteringsinsatser hos våra kunder
* Bedömningssamtal
* Kartläggningar
* Koordinering av arbetsförmågebedömningar
* Utbildningar och föreläsningar
* Lagstadgade och allmänna hälsoundersökningar
* Vaccinationer
* Kontaktsköterska till utvalda kunder
* Mottagning på hälsocentret och företagsmottagning hos kund


**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av rehabkoordinering samt är legitimerad sjuksköterska, gärna med erfarenhet av företagshälsa. Det är mycket meriterande om du är utbildad företagssköterska. Du är van av att hålla i och delta på digitala möten.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har ett hälsofrämjande synsätt och ett genuint intresse för människor, arbetsmiljö och försäkringsmedicinska frågor. Du som vill arbeta och utvecklas med oss ska tycka om att arbeta konsultativt och ha lätt för att skapa relationer. Du är trygg och självgående med ett eget driv.
   

  

 Vi ser att du är bekväm med att arbeta i privat verksamhet, tycker om att arbeta nära kunderna och har ett affärsmässigt förhållningssätt. Du är strukturerad och har god IT-kunskap. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Hos Avonova får du ett omväxlande och stimulerande arbete i ett företag som växer och utvecklas, tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor. Vi erbjuder dig stora möjligheter till utveckling inom din profession och i företagshälsa. Vi är en engagerad arbetsgrupp med hög kompetens och lång erfarenhet inom företagshälsa, och vi arbetar med spännande och utmanande kunder i varierande branscher och verksamheter.
   

  

 Tycker du att detta låter intressant? Varmt välkommen med din ansökan med CV och personligt brev. Vi arbetar med löpande urval så vi sänd gärna in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Utdrag ur belastningsregistret samt drogtest kommer att ske i samband med anställning.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer kontakta hälsocenterchef Anna Augustson, anna.augustson@avonova.se.
   

  

 Vi arbetar givetvis aktivt med vårt systematiska arbetsmiljöarbete. Vi är medlemmar i Almega med kollektivavtal med Vårdföretagarna, Vårdförbundet, LSR, Läkarförbundet och Vision.
   

  

 Alla erbjudanden om rekryterings- och annonseringshjälp undanbedes.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/37 | Kontakt: Anna Augustson , | Publicerat: 2025-06-30 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-01

title: Ops Supervisor Upplands Väsby
description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as an Operations Supervisor.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Supervising a team of operatives and drivers
* Making sure all team members are motivated and treated fairly and consistently
* Planning and taking action to achieve service levels targets
* Educating your team on business goals and service objectives
* Making sure your team follows safe, secure and operationally compliant working practices during the shift


**What Do You Bring With You**
* Experience in managing a shift and team in a busy freight processing environment is desirable
* Ability to manage own and teams time effectively with attention to detail
* Be energetic and enthusiastic
* Have a strong customer focus
* Have good communication skills


**What Do We Offer**
* Attractive compensation package
* Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
* Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
* Tuition Assistance Program (\*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
* Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
* Employee reduced-rate shipping
* Great career opportunities
* FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


 Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.
   

  

 Location: Upplands väsby
   

  

 Working hours: Varied working hours (day- evening and possibly weekend shifts)
   

  

 FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all
   

  

 Our Company
   

  

 FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.
   

  

 Our Philosophy
   

  

 The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.
   

  

 Our Culture
   

  

 Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

title: eCommerce Key Account Manager
description:
**Kenvue Is Currently Recruiting For A:**
 E-commerce Key Account Manager
   

  

****What We Do****
 At Kenvue, we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including NEUTROGENA®, AVEENO®, TYLENOL®, LISTERINE®, JOHNSON’S® and BAND-AID® that you already know and love. Science is our passion; care is our talent.
   

  

****Who We Are****
 Our global team is ~ 22,000 brilliant people with a workplace culture where every voice matters, and every contribution is appreciated. We are passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours. For more information, click here.
   

  

****Role Reports To:****
 Interim Head of Nordics
   

  

**Location:**
 Europe/Middle East/Africa, Sweden, Stockholm, Solna
   

  

**Work Location:**
 Hybrid
   

  

****What You Will Do****
 Kenvue is currently recruiting for:
   

  

**Amazon eCommerce Key Account Manager**
 This position reports into Magnus Tegstrom and is based at Solna, Sweden.
   

  

****Who We Are****
 Our global team is ~ 22,000 brilliant people with a workplace culture where every voice matters, and every contribution is appreciated. We are passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage - and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future-and yours. For more information, click here.
   

  

**Role reports to:** 
 Magnus Tegstrom
   

  

**Location:** 
 Solna, Sweden
   

  

**Travel %:**
****What You Will Do****
 Kenvue are seeking a motivated and driven high-performing individual to join our growing Nordics eCommerce team as eCommerce Key account Manager, primarily to accelerate the Amazon business, as well as unlocking further growth opportunities with accounts such as Lycos, Boost, Etam. Reporting into the head of Nordics, the primary objective of the eCommerce CDM role is to support delivery of customer revenue targets by driving increased eCommerce sales and winning share across all categories Kenvue play in. You will lead the execution of customer sales and marketing programs and have ownership of the customer relationships. This will include influencing & executing shopper strategies, driving assortment, pricing, operational set-up as well as leading customer negotiations and annual business plans. Youl will also work very closely with the Kenvue EMEA ecommerce team as part of the Amazon Pan EU model, being the key voice for what Sweden needs to win with Amazon as well as sharing learnings to continue to raise the bar.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Internally & externally, the day-to-day lead and owner for your business with responsibilities including:
+ Full accurate forecasting and P&L ownership for Amazon & other accounts, delivering on specified business targets (sales, spend and profit targets - INS, TCI, NTS, Net GP)
+ Collaborate with squads, digital teams, EMEA/NE ecom teams, media agencies and commercial strategy teams to identify and execute eCommerce opportunities, keeping the business informed of any progress/challenges and support needed
+ Ensure we have an ‘outside in’ lens on the business looking at competitor activities in the eCommerce channel and in your account.
+ Support eCommerce customer service teams and supply chain to ensure processes are operating efficiently, especially important for the scaling of the Amazon business
+ Prioritise commercial fundamentals including Spike & core range recommendations to drive sustainable topline and bottom line growth.
+ Lazer focus on the digital shelf – to ensure PDP content is compelling to accelerate conversion
+ Designing and executing great business plans including negotiating the implementation
+ Build and lead promotional activities in line with Kenvue corporate guidelines
+ Analyse channel performance, and create plans to optimize top and bottom-line
+ Identify share of voice opportunities to drive market out-performance
+ Execute an aligned commercial & media plan with priority focus on winning search
+ Drive excellence in execution of innovation and integrated brand campaigns, ensuring brand visibility and optimising customer engagement
+ Develop share winning plans through eventing
+ Propose and pilot new e-commerce tactics such as bundling, subscription models, or loyalty programs to drive engagement
+ Building positive relationships with your key contacts/buyers
+ Stay informed about industry trends and best practices, especially within FMCG e-commerce, health, and beauty sectors


**Required Qualifications**
**What we are looking for**
* Progressive experience in Key account & eCommerce key account management or related sales
* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or related field
* Proven track record of driving sales and exceeding targets in an eCommerce environment
* Strong negotiation and communication skills – with focus on strong story telling
* Demonstrates a growth mindset, bold ambition and willingness to challenge the status quo.


**Desired Qualifications**
* Proven track record of successfully managing key accounts and driving sales growth
* Strategic thinker with the ability to analyze market data and develop actionable insights
* Highly organized and detail-oriented with a focus on achieving results
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and CRM software for sales tracking and reporting
* Entrepreneurial mindset with a proactive approach to problem-solving
* Team player with a strong sense of accountability and drive for success


****What’s In It For You****
* Paid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Volunteer Time & More!
* Learning & Development Opportunities
* Kenvuer Impact Networks
* This list could vary based on location/region


 Kenvue is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment based on merit without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
   

  

 If you are an individual with a disability, please check our Disability Assistance page for information on how to request an accommodation.

title: Anaplan Analyst
description:
Spaulding Ridge is an advisory and IT implementation firm. We help global organizations get financial clarity into the complex, daily sales, and operational decisions that impact profitable revenue generations, efficient operational performance, and reliable financial management.
   

  

 At Spaulding Ridge, we believe all business is personal. Core to our values is our relationships with our clients, our business partners, our team, and the global community. Our employees dedicate their time to helping our clients transform their business, from strategy through implementation and business transformation.
   

  

 We are looking for an
 **Anaplan Analyst** 
 to join our
 **Anaplan Delivery** 
 team in Sweden!
   

  

 As an
 **Anaplan Analyst** 
 , you will gain hands-on experience supporting our clients within our Anaplan practice by solving problems and bringing innovative ideas to our international clients and teams.
   

  

**The role**
* Collaborate with team members to design and implement technology that aligns with client business objectives.
* Build mock Proof of Concepts within Anaplan for potential clients.
* Identify issues and structural problems and generate actionable recommendations using Anaplan implementation methodologies.
* Understand client business needs, goals, and objectives.


**You have**
* 1-2 years required of finance/FP&A, supply chain, and/or sales operations experience
* Degree in Finance, Accounting, Logistics, and/or Management Information Systems
* Strong skillset within Excel. Including an understanding of how to develop macros, and model large data sets utilizing Lookups and SumIf functions.
* Strong knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite
* Sound understanding of Multi-Dimensional data architecture
* Previous Anaplan experience and certifications preferred but not required
* Experience with any business planning and modeling tools is preferred
* Fluency in English and Swedish is needed for this role, as you would be part of the local and international team.


 Please note that you need to be based in Stockholm or within a commutable distance and have a valid work/residency permit in Sweden to be considered for this job opportunity. We will not be able to consider remote candidates for this role.
   

  

**We take care of you!**
 At Spaulding Ridge, we believe all business is personal. Each interaction with clients and colleagues is an opportunity to connect and contribute to mutual success.
   

  

 We work with leading companies across the globe, giving our teams the necessary autonomy for efficient execution, which truly differentiates us from our competitors. At Spaulding Ridge we prioritize our employees’ professional development through challenging and meaningful work, offering top-notch training, mentoring, and ample growth opportunities. At the core of our culture is an entrepreneurial spirit that celebrates the unique perspectives of our employees and drives a commitment to positive change in our communities and world.
   

  

 We offer a competitive benefits package, including extended PTO, flexible working, individual learning stipend, private medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and much more.
   

  

 https://www.spauldingridge.com/about-us/careers/
   

  

**Spaulding Ridge’s Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace**
 When we engage the expertise, insights, and creativity of people from all walks of life, we become a better organization, we deliver superior services to clients, and we transform our communities and world for the better.
   

  

 At Spaulding Ridge, we believe our team should reflect the rich diversity of society and we take seriously the responsibility to cultivate a workplace where every bandmate feels accepted, respected, and valued for who they are. We do this by creating a culture of trust and belonging, through practices and policies that support inclusion, and through our employee led Employee Resource Groups (ERGs): CRE (Cultural Race and Ethnicity), Women Elevate, PROUD and Mental Wellness Alliance.
   

  

 The company is committed to offering Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with Spaulding Ridge and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to our VP of Human Resources, Cara Halladay (challaday@spauldingridge.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
   

  

 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

title: Senior Projektledare - Sectra Medical
description:
**Senior Projektledare – Sectra Medical**
 Vill du bidra till framtidens sjukvård och vara en nyckelspelare i att driva strategiskt viktiga projekt i ett internationellt sammanhang? Nu söker vi en erfaren projektledare som vill vara med och forma vår leveransorganisation inom medicinsk IT – och samtidigt göra verklig skillnad för patienter inom Norden.
   

  

**Om Sectra**
 Sectra är ledande inom IT-lösningar för medicinsk bildhantering. Våra lösningar används av sjukhus och vårdgivare globalt för att effektivisera diagnostik och förbättra vårdresultat. Vi ligger i framkant inom övergången till molnbaserade tjänster (SaaS) och söker nu dig som vill vara en drivande kraft i denna transformation.
   

  

 Hos oss får du arbeta med några av branschens mest engagerade och kompetenta kollegor. Vår företagskultur präglas av samarbete, innovation och ett genuint fokus på kundnytta.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
* Ett arbete med samhällsnytta på riktigt – varje projekt påverkar människors liv
* Ett företag som prioriterar teknisk excellens, lärande och samarbete
* Möjlighet att forma hur framtidens leveranser ska se ut inom medicinsk IT
* Internationell arbetsmiljö och kontakt med kunder och kollegor världen över
* Flexibelt arbetssätt med möjlighet till hybridarbete


**Om rollen**
 Som senior projektledare på Sectra blir du en central aktör i vår leveransverksamhet, där du leder komplexa projekt från initiering till go-live. Du kommer att arbeta nära våra regionala team, kunder och teknikspecialister, med särskilt fokus på molnleveranser, integrationer och effektiv projektstyrning i en miljö med höga krav på tillförlitlighet och patientsäkerhet.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:**
* Leda och driva leveransprojekt med hög komplexitet
* Agera länk mellan teknik, verksamhet och kund – från behovsanalys till implementation
* Proaktivt identifiera risker, säkra resurser och arbeta mot definierade milstolpar och budget
* Stötta och coacha juniora projektledare i teamet
* Utveckla processer och arbetssätt inom projektstyrning och leverans


 ,
   

  

**Kvalifikationer** 
 På Sectra prioriterar vi alltid attityd och förmåga när vi rekryterar. Vi brukar säga ”Hire for attitude and ability. Train for skill.” Det betyder att vem du är och din potential är mycket viktigare än vilken kunskap du har idag eller vilka jobb du haft tidigare. Det finns ett par grundläggande egenskaper som är viktiga på Sectra oavsett vilken roll du söker. Vi letar efter en vilja och förmåga att lära sig nya saker och att ta sig an nya uppgifter och utmaningar snabbt. Vi vill att du har en stark analytisk ådra där vi särskilt värdesätter förmågan att förstå, bryta ner och därmed kunna börja lösa även komplexa problem. Vi vill att du kan kommunicera och interagera med kollegor, partners och kunder på ett tydligt, konstruktivt och effektivt sätt.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av projektledning inom tekniska och/eller verksamhetskritiska IT-projekt – gärna med koppling till sjukvård, infrastruktur eller SaaS-leveranser.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi följande krav:**
* Relevant akademisk examen inom IT, teknik eller motsvarande
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som projektledare inom IT eller teknik
* Erfarenhet av att driva större implementations- eller transformationsprojekt
* Mycket god teknisk förståelse och vana att kommunicera med tekniker såväl som verksamhetsrepresentanter
* Mycket god förmåga att kommunicera på både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Vi ser det även som en fördel om du:**
* Har erfarenhet från sjukvårdssektorn, särskilt RIS/PACS
* Certifiering inom t.ex. PRINCE2, PMP, ITIL eller motsvarande
* Talar flera språk än svenska och engelska
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta i eller med andra kulturer
* Har intressen utanför arbete eller studier, såsom sport, föreningsliv, musik, ridning, sång eller kanske till och med flygning, eller något annat som gör att du sticker ut ur mängden.


 Är du redo för nästa steg i karriären och vill göra skillnad på riktigt? Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt – vi behandlar ansökningar löpande.

title: Sourcing Manager
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage and Wholesale Import and Export
description:
Brinner du för strategiskt inköp och vill vara med och forma framtidens affärer? PostNord söker en engagerad Sourcing Manager till Group Sourcing - en viktig roll där du får skapa verkligt värde för hela koncernen. Vi är mitt i en spännande förändringsresa där inköp står högt på agendan. Här får du möjlighet att påverka på riktigt, i en organisation som spelar en avgörande roll i samhället.
   

  

 Du, Vi & Jobbet
   

  

 I rollen som Sourcing Manager arbetar du tätt tillsammans med sakägare för att optimera koncernens inköp med fokus på kostnadseffektivitet, kundnytta, hållbarhet och lagmässiga krav. Du ingår i ett sammansvetsat inköpsteam bestående av Category Managers, Sourcing Managers och Sourcing Analysts, som tillsammans med organisationens olika delar driver strategiska inköpsinitiativ för att skapa långsiktigt värde för hela koncernen.
   

  

 Vad kommer du att göra?
   

  

 Som Sourcing Manager på PostNord bidrar du starkt till att driva och utveckla koncernens strategiska inköpsarbete. Tjänsten innebär bland annat att du
   

  

* Leder och genomför upphandlingar, företrädesvis inom kategorierna IT, HR Related Services, Facility Management, Marketing Communications, Professional Services och Travel
* Utvecklar och omförhandlar befintliga leverantörsavtal samt säkerställer att avtal efterlevs
* Samarbetar med Category Managers för att ta fram långsiktiga kategoristrategier
* Arbetar aktivt med Supplier Relationship Management och hållbarhet i leverantörsledet


 Du rapporterar till Manager Sourcing och tillhör ett team med ansvar för inköp inom flera kategorier på koncernnivå.
   

  

 Vem söker vi?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som arbetar strukturerat, effektivt och har en god förmåga att prioritera och organisera ditt arbete. Du är resultatinriktad och driver saker i mål. Du tar gärna egna initiativ och bygger lätt goda relationer, både internt och externt. Det är självklart för dig att dela med dig av din kunskap och du sätter värde på att aktivt bidra till en kultur präglad av samarbete och tillit. Med ett affärsmässigt förhållningssätt, stort engagemang och en förmåga att driva ditt arbete framåt, trivs du med att både arbeta självständigt och som en del av ett lag.
   

  

 Din erfarenhet
   

  

* Relevant akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande
* Flera års erfarenhet av strategiskt inköp
* Goda kunskaper i förhandlingsteknik samt avtalshantering
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, tal och skrift


 Tidigare erfarenhet från LOU/LUF liksom att jobba i en internationell miljö är meriterande men inte ett krav.
   

  

 Du ska må bra
   

  

 Vi är ett modernt kundorienterat företag som tänker lika mycket på våra anställda som på våra kunder. Hos oss erbjuds du ett omväxlande arbete i en internationell miljö med ständigt nya utmaningar och snabba beslut. Förutom schyssta anställningsvillkor enligt kollektivavtal erbjuds du
   

  

* Flexibel hybrid arbetsplats. Se filmen om vårt kontor.
* Goda utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter
* Goda försäkrings- och tjänstepensionsvillkor
* Friskvårdsbidrag samt möjlighet att träna på Arkens gym och simhall
* Personalförmåner genom PostNord Plus - vår personalstiftelse


 Om oss
   

  

 PostNord's vision är att vara favoritleverantören i Norden. Vi har ett viktigt samhällsuppdrag och säkerställer kommunikations- och logistiklösningar för företag och privatpersoner. Vi är i en ständig transformation och arbetar konsekvent med att utveckla både vårt erbjudande och våra medarbetare, allt för att nå vår vision samt göra vardagen enklare och mer hållbar för alla som bor och arbetar i Norden. Vi är PostNord - ett fantastiskt företag att jobba och växa med. Läs mer på group.postnord.com
   

  

 Vad väntar du på?
   

  

 Vi kommer att påbörja urvalsarbetet först i augusti men ser gärna att du ansöker så snart du kan! I den här rekryteringen samarbetar PostNord med Jefferson Wells. Om du har frågor eller funderingar, vänligen maila malin.magnusson@jeffersonwells.se eller ring på 076-780 68 64.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om våra fackliga kontakter

title: Account Manager who builds lasting partnerships and drives growth
description:
At Prisjakt, we believe that strong relationships are the foundation for success. We are looking for a passionate Account Manager to own and grow a portfolio of small to medium-sized business (SMB) accounts, helping our customers thrive while contributing to Prisjakt’s continued growth.
   

  

**Your mission, should you choose to accept it:**
 As an Account Manager, you will be the trusted partner and main point of contact for your customers. Your day will be spent understanding their business needs, identifying opportunities to add value through Prisjakt’s services, and helping them succeed in an ever-changing e-commerce landscape. You’ll manage the full customer lifecycle, while collaborating closely with internal teams like Product, Marketing, and Data to ensure our offerings meet customer needs.
   

  

 You naturally build trust and maintain strong relationships, always ready to listen, advise, and negotiate. Your proactive approach helps you spot upsell and cross-sell opportunities, while your structured mindset ensures smooth account management and accurate reporting.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing:**
* Own and grow a portfolio of SMB accounts, delivering value that fuels both customer success and Prisjakt’s revenue growth
* Act as the key contact for day-to-day communication, building trust and long-term partnerships
* Understand customer business models, challenges, and goals to tailor solutions effectively
* Identify commercial opportunities independently and collaborate with stakeholders to resolve challenges
* Provide the customer voice internally to influence product development and service improvements
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of account activities and performance


**What You’ll Bring:**
* Proven track record managing multiple customer accounts with success
* Strong interpersonal skills and a genuine relationship-building mindset
* Good understanding of digital services and the e-commerce ecosystem
* Confident communication and negotiation skills, both verbal and written
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to turn data into actionable insights
* Excellent English and Swedish skills
* A structured approach to problem-solving and good time management skills


**We offer:**
* Flexible hours and hybrid work, with four days a week at the office
* Two paid working hours weekly for wellness.
* Your birthday off, every year.


*When* 
 : We review applications on a rolling basis, so apply today!
   

  

*Where* 
 : You will be located at our Stockholm studio.
   

  

*The very core in our employee experience is to care for our employees. With us you have flexible hours and a hybrid way of working where we meet 4 days per week in the studio. You get two paid working hours each week dedicated to working out and you’re always off on your birthday. If you’re curious to know more about life at Prisjakt, our* 
*benefits* 
*or* 
*why we exist* 
*you should definitely explore our* 
*career site* 
*. Want to meet the brilliant people and get a feel for the vibe at our studios? Make sure to follow us on Instagram @* 
*Prisjakt*

title: Senior Platform Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, Internet Marketplace Platforms, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**About Gelato** 




 Gelato has created the world’s largest global network for on-demand production of custom products – from t-shirts and mugs to books and wall art. We empower a new generation of ecommerce entrepreneurs to share their creativity worldwide while embracing local, sustainable production. By producing locally and perfectly matching supply with demand, we eliminate waste and reduce carbon emissions.
 



  





 At Gelato, we don’t own production facilities – we build the software that connects them. With over 140 production partners in 32 countries, our network can deliver custom products to five billion people in just 72 hours. It’s smarter, faster, and greener.
 



  





 With GelatoConnect, our SaaS platform, we’re driving innovation in print production. GelatoConnect simplifies operations for print producers by automating procurement, workflows, and logistics into one seamless system. By boosting efficiency and cutting costs, it helps businesses scale to meet market demands. With GelatoConnect, we’re reshaping the print industry to be more efficient, sustainable, and profitable.
 



  





**Platform** 




**Gelato** 
 is an
 **AI-first** 
 , cloud-native platform transforming local, on-demand production and delivery — with zero physical assets. We power:
 


* **Global production orchestration** 
 : connecting e-commerce customers to 130+ partners across 32 countries. From AI-guided plate design to smart routing and logistics, we deliver to over 5 billion people in under 72 hours—faster, greener, smarter.
* **GelatoConnect** 
 : our AI-driven print production OS that helps producers master digital printing — from inventory to shipping — by automating every step: procurement, prepress, printing, packaging, and dispatch. It’s machine-agnostic, real-time, and built for uptime, precision, and profitability.



  





**AI at the Core** 




 We are not just early adopters of AI — we’re
 **AI-native builders** 
 . Across engineering, product, and operations, we embrace AI to accelerate innovation:
 


* **AI-first development** 
 using LLMs for code generation, testing, documentation, and design exploration.
* **Autonomous AI agents** 
 driving platform resilience, observability, cost control, and internal workflow automation.
* **AI-native product features** 
 built into GelatoConnect and the core platform — improving routing, personalization, and production optimization.
* A culture of
 **continuous experimentation** 
 with RAG, agent orchestration, prompt engineering, and model fine-tuning.



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Ensure 24/7 platform operations, including on-call support and incident response.
* Build and evolve
 **AI agents** 
 that automate scaling, recovery, and diagnostics through control-plane patterns and event-driven logic.
* Manage
 **multi-cloud infrastructure** 
 , including serverless, through declarative, automated workflows.
* Collaborate with the
 **Delivery Platform** 
 team to improve DevEx with intelligent internal tooling.
* Drive
 **reliability, observability, and cost-efficiency** 
 across Gelato’s global infrastructure.
* Enable engineers with
 **self-service, secure, and scalable delivery pipelines** 
 .



  





**Qualifications** 



* Deep understanding of
 **Linux fundamentals** 
 (processes, I/O, filesystems, networking, memory management, system internals).
* Deep experience with
 **AWS** 
 (primary)
 **and GCP** 
 (bonus), including cost optimizations, EKS, networking, S3, VPC peering, IAM, and related services.
* Strong understanding of
 **Kubernetes internals** 
 , including networking, security, and cluster operations.
* Hands-on experience with
 **GitOps workflows** 
 (e.g. ArgoCD) and
 **Infrastructure as Code** 
 using Terraform.
* Proficient in
 **Python, Go** 
 , or other languages — with a willingness to learn Go if not already familiar.
* Comfortable using
 **AI development tools** 
 like Cursor, Claude, and coding with LLMs.



  





 Experience with or strong interest in building
 **AI agents and RAG workflows** 
 , with a commitment to learn if needed.
 



  





**What it’s like to work at Gelato** 




 We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.
 



  





 At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.
 



  





 Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in
 **English** 
 , regardless of which country you are applying from.

title: Senior Manager, Public Relations (Bangkok-based, Relocation Provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 The Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. The department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable channels. The team combines a blend of talents from the best analysts, marketing strategists, data scientists and brand specialists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 The global Communications function is responsible for building and protecting Agoda’s reputation as a trusted and innovative brand with partners and consumer worldwide. Our Communications team oversees 10+ managed markets, supporting different parts of the business to help share Agoda’s story. The person who fills this senior PR Manager role will be central to making us even more impactful as part of an international, results-focused Communications team. We move fast and leverage many channels to reach our audiences. You’ll be able to make a difference quickly, contributing ideas and helping to shape our thinking.
   

  

 The role will be based in Bangkok, Thailand and will be reporting to the Director of Communications
   

  

**In this Role, you’ll get to:**
* Shape and define the PR strategy to elevate Agoda’s visibility in markets across Asia Pacific and beyond
* Manage and develop two direct reports, providing regular feedback, coaching, and support to help them achieve their goals
* Manage multi market agency teams to deliver measurable consumer content
* Ideate scalable content to keep Agoda in the news leveraging a combination of data, product, campaign and corporate news
* Keeping a finger on the pulse of breaking news, spotting trends and other editorial/content opportunities for Agoda, what makes the news and how to create that narrative
* Problem solving to develop creative media relations strategies, while also being analytical and measurement driven
* Providing input for the Agoda global team drafting pitches, media briefings, Q&As as well as generating campaign ideas
* Responding to global media enquiries and maintaining the Agoda press office
* Managing and counselling stakeholders throughout Agoda who require PR support


**What you’ll Need to Succeed:**
* Creative thinking and an all-round make-it-happen team attitude
* 8+ years of experience in public relations in traditional and digital teams,  advantageous, ideally in both an agency and in-house setting. Experience should include 3+ years managing teams or direct reports.
* Strong story-telling experience to consumer, corporate and B2B audiences
* Demonstrable experience of an integrated approach to PR (content, social media, influencers, media partnership etc.)
* Strong media contacts; sound knowledge of influencers and non-traditional channels
* Great English writing, editing and proof-reading skills.
* Crisis and issues management experience would be beneficial
* Quick thinking and ability to spot trends and exploit opportunities to respond quickly to social sentiment
* Project management capabilities and experience in managing creative and production resources
* Experience in working within a matrix organization structure, across multiple markets and influencing different internal and external stakeholders
* Experience of managing and optimizing budgets
* Ability to measure quality/impact of content for future improvement
